intro: Phacelia incana, commonly known as silver phacelia, is a flowering plant native to the western United States. It is a member of the Boraginaceae family and is characterized by its hairy, silver-gray leaves and clusters of blue to purple flowers. The plant typically grows in dry, rocky soils and is often found in open habitats such as meadows and grasslands. It is known for its ability to attract pollinators like bees and butterflies. Phacelia incana is also used in restoration projects due to its hardy nature and aesthetic value.
